revised_title: The Influence of Foreign Gases on the Thermal Decomposition of Nitrous Oxide
tldr: This study investigates the influence of foreign gases on the thermal decomposition of nitrous oxide. The researchers found that the addition of gases like argon, nitrogen, and carbon dioxide affects the rate of decomposition. They proposed a theory that suggests the existence of potentially rate-determining processes other than energization of molecules in collisions and chemical decomposition. This theory links to certain spectroscopic considerations previously advanced by Herzberg and offers a better explanation of the complex group of phenomena observed in the study.
